perturbation.original_text: ensure that in the event that user traffic to the Co-Branded Site falls below the levels outlined in Schedule 2, that MediaLinx will use all commercially reasonable efforts to increase promotion to the Co-Branded Site until usage to the site increases to levels above the levels outlined in Schedule 2; and
perturbation.changed_text: ensure that in the event that user traffic to the Co-Branded Site falls below acceptable levels, that MediaLinx will consider promotional activities to increase traffic to the Co-Branded Site; and
perturbation.explanation: By removing the specific reference to 'Schedule 2', the contract now lacks a defined metric for acceptable user traffic. The original text obligates MediaLinx to use 'commercially reasonable efforts' to increase promotion until the site reaches the 'levels outlined in Schedule 2'. The revised version replaces 'levels outlined in Schedule 2' with 'acceptable levels', introducing ambiguity. This contradiction and omission create uncertainty in enforcement because 'acceptable levels' is subjective and undefined within the contract.

perturbation.original_text: HCI shall pay MLX a guaranteed fixed sum of [*] US per annum during the Initial Term of this Agreement to be paid out as a monthly payment of [*] US (the "Monthly Payment"). This Monthly Payment shall be due by the 10th day of each month;
perturbation.changed_text: HCI shall pay MLX a sum of money per annum during the term of this agreement to be paid out as a monthly payment. This Monthly Payment shall be due as agreed upon in writing;
perturbation.explanation: By omitting the reference to '[*] US' which defines the exact amount of the monthly payment, it contradicts other clauses that assume the payment amount is fixed and known. Removing the fixed amount introduces ambiguity, making it unclear how payments will be calculated or enforced. This omission contradicts other sections of the contract which references to payments. [*] = CERTAIN INFORMATION ON THIS PAGE HAS BEEN OMITTED AND FILED SEPARATELY WITH THE COMMISSION. CONFIDENTIAL TREATMENT HAS BEEN REQUESTED WITH RESPECT TO THE OMITTED PORTIONS.

perturbation.original_text: HCI shall ensure that the level of Canadian content contained on the Co-Branded Site is maintained at such levels as is found on the HealthyWay section of the Sympatico web site on the Launch Date, and ensure that the level of Canadian content is maintained in accordance with the attached Schedule "3";
perturbation.changed_text: HCI shall ensure that the level of Canadian content contained on the Co-Branded Site is maintained in accordance with standards found on similar Canadian websites;
perturbation.explanation: By removing the specific reference to 'Schedule 3', which contains detailed guidelines and requirements for maintaining Canadian content, the contract becomes vague and unenforceable. The original text ties the required level of Canadian content to both the 'HealthyWay section' and 'Schedule 3'. The revised version removes Schedule 3, replacing it with 'standards found on similar Canadian websites', which is subjective and lacks a concrete definition. This creates an in-text contradiction because Schedule 9 details content moderation on the other hand. The omitted definition creates uncertainty in enforcement.
